Holt |Ship christened= |Ship completed= |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned=24 July 1982 |Ship recommissioned= |Ship decommissioned=10 July 1998 |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship renamed= |Ship reclassified= |Ship refit= |Ship struck=10 July 1998 |Ship reinstated= |Ship homeport= |Ship identification= |Ship motto= From Sails to Atoms |Ship nickname= |Ship honors= |Ship captured= |Ship fate= To be disposed of by submarine recycling |Ship status= |Ship notes= |Ship badge=[[Image:Insignia of SSN-704 Baltimore.PNG|200px]] }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class= [[Los Angeles class submarine]] |Ship type= |Ship tonnage= 6900 |Ship displacement= 5,714 tons light, 6,087 tons full, 373 tons dead |Ship length= {{convert|110.3|m|ftin|abbr=on}} |Ship beam= {{convert|10|m|ftin|abbr=on}} |Ship height= |Ship draft= {{convert|9.7|m|ftin|abbr=on}} |Ship depth= 800 ft + |Ship decks= 3 |Ship power= Nuclear (Light Water Reactor) |Ship propulsion=[[S6G reactor|S6G nuclear reactor]] |Ship speed= 25 knot + |Ship range= |Ship endurance= |Ship test depth= |Ship complement=12 officers and 98 enlisted |Ship time to activate= |Ship sensors= BQQ 5D |Ship EW= |Ship armament= 4 Ã— 21 in (533 mm) torpedo tubes |Ship armor= |Ship notes= }} |} '''USS ''Baltimore'' (SSN-704)''', a [[Los Angeles class submarine|''Los Angeles''-class submarine]], was the sixth ship of the [[United States Navy]] to be named for [[Baltimore, Maryland]]. The contract to build her was awarded to the [[Electric Boat]] Division of [[General Dynamics]] Corporation in [[Groton, Connecticut]] on 31 October 1973 and her keel was laid down on 21 May 1979. She was [[ship naming and launching|launched]] on 13 December 1980 sponsored by the Honorable Marjorie S. Holt, and [[ship commissioning|commissioned]] on 24 July 1982 with Captain Michael D. Bradley in command. The Ships logo was "From Sails to Atoms," as inscribed on the ships original plaque. ''Baltimore'' was decommissioned and stricken from the [[Naval Vessel Register]] on 10 July 1998. Ex-''Baltimore'' is scheduled to be disposed of through the Nuclear Powered [[Ship and Submarine Recycling Program]] in [[Bremerton, Washington]]. ==References== {{DANFSNVR}} {{Los Angeles class submarine}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Baltimore (SSN-704)}} [[Category:Los Angeles-class submarines]] [[Category:Cold War submarines of the United States]] [[Category:Nuclear ships of the United States Navy]] [[Category:United States Navy Maryland-related ships]] [[Category:1980 ships]] [[Category:Ships built in Connecticut]]
